comments.body:
Forbidding explicit usage of `tc` here is a little counter-intuitive to lexical scoping, given the literal reading of `import A._`.

What about the following:

- `import A._` to import all members for _explicit_ usage
- `implied A._` to enable implied instances defined in `A` for _implicit_ resolution
- `implied A.c` make `A.c` available for implicit resolution, no matter _A.c_ is implicit or not.

The last one is up to debate, the idea is to encourage _use-site implicits_ over _definition-site implicits_.
Would it be possible to use this feature to make any member a candidate for implicit resolution in scope, i.e. `import implied A.foo`?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +7,11 @@  import A._
  foo            // error: no implicit argument was found
  foo given tc   // error: not found: tc
  foo given A.tc // ok
}
